current_session.summary: System Development Day: Built comprehensive trades_ledger.json with all 5 historical trades fully documented. Redesigned command center dashboard with real data integration, pre-entry threat assessment checklist, rule compliance tracking. Analyzed performance by setup type (hedges 100% win, fades 0%). Created Rules #7 and #17. Identified clear edge and weakness patterns. Backed up and pushed to git.
key_decisions: Built trades_ledger.json as unified source of truth (all 5 trades documented)
Redesigned dashboard: eliminated clutter, added 3-column layout, interactive checklist
Implemented live data integration (dashboard pulls from trades_ledger.json)
Identified clear edge: inverse ETF hedges 100% vs range fades 0%
Created Rule #17: never enter on external advice without verification
Set up backup and git versioning system
lessons_learned: Data reveals edge: once documented, performance patterns become obvious
Pre-entry checklist prevents over-eager entries (like Oct 27 Chris Lori trade)
Compliance directly correlates with wins: 100% compliance = 100% win rate in sample
Over-eagerness has clear trigger: choppy market structure + external conviction
Dashboard as enforcement: prevents behavioral mistakes that rules can't catch
Profit factor 2.06:1 indicates solid edge, just needs compliance improvement
patterns_identified: Inverse ETF hedges: 100% win rate (Oct 15 +$181, Oct 17 +$100)
Full compliance = wins (2/2 compliant trades won)
Over-eagerness in choppy markets (when signal <50 or structure unclear)
open_questions: Can compliance improve from 40% to 80%+ with dashboard checklist enforcement?
Will inverse ETF hedge edge hold over next 5 trades?
How much will compliance improvement impact win rate?
next_session_focus: Execute 1-2 inverse ETF hedge trades with 100% compliance
Use dashboard pre-entry checklist for every trade (gate entries)
Avoid range fades until clear structure appears
Track progress toward $2,500 monthly goal ($1,221 remaining in October)

session_history.summary: Initial Wingman load and continuity system creation

active_hypotheses.hypothesis: FOMC Oct 29 dovish outcome will trigger +3-5% equity rally and +5-8% BTC move
evidence: Institutional accumulation ongoing (Saylor +390 BTC, Trump miners +1.4K BTC)
Fear & Greed at 40 = historically 80%+ win rate for 3-month forward returns

active_hypotheses.hypothesis: Market consolidating at contrarian inflection, not weakness. Defensive positioning optimal pre-FOMC.
evidence: Signal 45.5/100 reflects caution, not bearish bias
counter_evidence: Breadth 12.5/25 means only 1 in 8 stocks participating

current_market_thesis.stance: Defensive positioning into FOMC binary event
key_assumptions: Signal 45.5 reflects prudent caution, not bearish bias
Fear & Greed 40 = historically strong entry zone (80%+ 3-month win rate)
FOMC Oct 29 is binary catalyst (dovish = rally, hawkish = retest lows)

performance_tracking.best_setup_type: Inverse ETF hedges (100% win rate) - Oct 15 +$181, Oct 17 +$100
performance_tracking.worst_setup_type: Range fades (0% win rate) - Oct 13 -$100, Oct 14 -$15
performance_tracking.pattern_observation: 100% compliance on Oct 15 & 17 = 100% wins. 0% compliance on Oct 27 = loss. Clear correlation.
performance_tracking.notes: System fully functional. Dashboard now provides enforcement. Edge identified (hedges). Main opportunity: compliance improvement 40%→80% should drive win rate 40%→60%+.
